intro: Lepidium cumingianum var. subsagittatum, commonly known as the sagittate cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its small, edible leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
